Home Gallery Slideshow Solar System Space //Planets Mercury Venus Earth Mars Jupiter Saturn Uranus Neptune The Earth is the third planet from the sun. The Earth is separated by distinct layers with a core, mantle and crust. Imagine Earth as a chocolate-covered cherry. If you stick a pencil directly through the Earth at the point of rotation, these two points are the North and South poles. Geographically speaking, itâ€™s where lines of longitude meet. Home Quiz
